description: Test AI's judgment on WHEN to create artifacts, WHAT to modify (data/UI/both), and WHEN to leave them alone

evaluation_criteria.proactive_creation: Creates artifacts for complex problems without being asked
evaluation_criteria.restraint: Does NOT create artifacts for casual conversation
evaluation_criteria.data_only_updates: Can update data without touching UI/styling
evaluation_criteria.ui_only_updates: Can update styling/layout without touching data
evaluation_criteria.preservation: Leaves artifact unchanged when user doesn't request changes
evaluation_criteria.complete_overhaul: Can rebuild entire artifact when needed
evaluation_criteria.timeliness: Artifact appears at the right moment in conversation

turns.user_says: I'm feeling overwhelmed with everything going on

expected_behavior.reasoning: Too vague, casual emotional expression - no artifact warranted yet

turns.user_says: It's just... I have the startup launch next week, Emma's science fair project is due Friday, Jake is struggling with reading, the house needs repairs, and I haven't exercised in a month. I don't even know where to start.

expected_behavior.reasoning: PROACTIVE: Complex multi-domain problem with clear overwhelm - visual map would help without being asked

turns.user_says: Yeah that helps. Actually Emma's project is due Thursday, not Friday

expected_behavior.reasoning: Simple data correction - change ONLY the deadline, touch nothing else

turns.user_says: Can you make the startup stuff stand out more? That's the most urgent

expected_behavior.reasoning: Visual/UI request - change ONLY styling/emphasis, data stays identical

turns.user_says: I talked to my co-founder and we're pushing the launch to next month

expected_behavior.response: acknowledge timeline change, note reduced pressure
expected_behavior.reasoning: Data change (deadline) + UI change (urgency) - both needed

turns.user_says: So what should I focus on this week?

expected_behavior.response: suggest focusing on Emma's project (Thu) and Jake's reading based on the artifact
expected_behavior.reasoning: Conversational question - artifact already shows priorities, no update needed

turns.user_says: Actually, can you completely redesign this? I want to see it as a weekly calendar view instead of a priority matrix

expected_behavior.reasoning: Complete UI overhaul - rebuild entire artifact with same data

turns.user_says: Thanks, this is really helpful. I think I'll tackle Emma's project tonight.

expected_behavior.reasoning: Casual update/gratitude - no artifact change needed

proactive_creation.criteria: Created useful artifact at turn 2 without being asked

restraint.criteria: Did NOT create artifacts at turns 1, 6, 8 (casual conversation)

data_only_precision.criteria: Turn 3: Changed ONLY deadline, preserved all styling/UI

ui_only_precision.criteria: Turn 4: Changed ONLY visual emphasis, preserved all data

combined_update.criteria: Turn 5: Updated both data and UI appropriately

complete_overhaul.criteria: Turn 7: Rebuilt entire artifact while preserving data

timeliness.criteria: Artifact appeared at right moment (turn 2, not turn 1)
